Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights and the service and accomodation was excellent. The room was very clean, modern and spacious, with very good sound proof windows. The bathroom had a great shower and large bath. The staff were very helpful with directions and planning tours (and spoke very good english). The location was great: two minutes walk to train, bus, and a five minute walk to the River Seine. It was in a lovely area with plenty of cafes nearby, shops and even a supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Parisien boutique hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dashador
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel set amidst the yuppie district of St Germain. Nestled on a tree-lined street just tucked away from the main road, La Villa is a newish boutique hotel that encompasses Parisian chic and warmth. The entrance/reception to the hotel is rather non-descript, and there are at least 3 other similar hotels on the same block on Rue de Jacob, but La Villa comes across as one of the newer ones. I like hotels that are understated, minimalist, spotless yet with an eye to detail. La Villa is all that. The room itself is a cosy size, with a small bathroom that has a bath-tub and a designer sink - try and figure out where the water come out from! Our room has a French window that overlooks the street - just your typical view of your typical Parisian side-street, but for the Francophiles, this oozes charm only the way Paris can. The room itself was spotless. The only thing was that our of the 40 or so TV channels, only about 2 (BBC and CNN) were in English - but that's France! Being a small boutique hotel, La Villa has a tiny bar next to the reception and a breakfast area in the basement. For the price of breakfast, I'd highly recommend heading to the many cafes and restaurants nearby. The location of the hotel couldn't be better. Away from the hustle and bustle of main street Blvd St Germain, but there are a number of cosy cafes just outside the hotel (and a tea-room that sells amazing macaroons right opposite). We discovered a quaint little Parisian restaurant that does amazing food (du Pied de Fouet) just round the corner. A couple of minutes walk from the hotel and you get to the heart of St Germain des Pres, with many bars, restaurants and cafes with al fresco dining set up just for people watching. I forgot just how walkable Paris is. It's easier to wander around on foot than to battle the maze of the metro. A 20 minute walk will get you to the Latin Quarter, where plenty of cafes and restaurants abound for which are considerably less expensive than St Germain. All in all, I loved this little gem of a hotel, and will most definitely stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Stylish Decor”
Reviews.Author: glasgow77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights over new year. On arrival we were told there were problems with the rooftop room we had booked and we were therefore upgraded to a junior suite. Suite was lovely - seperate sleeping area and sitting area, quite modern. On the 5th floor and was really quiet at night despite being so central. Only minor negatives I have with the room were that the small bottles of mineral water by the bed which were there on arrival were never replaced (for the cost of the room would really have expected that) and the over-bath shower in the bathroom was a bit dated and not that powerful and the bath quite high and difficult to climb in and out of. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on that. Did have drinks in the bar on a couple of evenings. Once service was excellent and the next night think we may have been served by someone who wasn't used to working behind the bar as he wasn't sure what gins they stocked and served it with no ice and no lime/lemon. Other than that staff in the hotel were all friendly and helpful despite our very rusty french! Would definitely recommend this hotel. Location was perfect for us - near metro but also walkable to most sights. Lots of nice bars, restaurants, cafes and shops roundabout but street was still nice and quiet at night

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Saint Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: Faxao
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located between the Saint-Germain-des-Pres abbey and the Laduree patisserie shop, spot in the heart of the famous 5me arr neighborhood and walking distance from the lively Quartier Latin. The superior room is reasonably large (for parisian standards) and furnished with a comfortable queen size bed. The very clean bathroom was the part we liked the least though: the washbowl was almost impossible to use given the extremely minimalist design and the narrow shaped bath tub made it pretty uncomfortable to have a decent shower. Reasonably priced if compared to its peers in the same area, it is a good choice especially if you can get a special deal.

Reviews.Title: “Tres chic”
Reviews.Author: Carole-and-Irv
Reviews.Content: An élégant boutique hôtel just down the street from Deux Magots and Flore and a lot of other great shops and bistros. One of the few in the area that (at this writing) is completely air conditioned, which can be important in Paris in August. We also loved that the room had enough shelf and closet space for all our stuff, as this was our last stop before heading home and we needed to get organized and repacked. Very nice decor with a really, spectacular glass-enclosed shower, and sufficient plugs to recharge everything. Breakfast buffet wasn't worth the price (22 E per person which, at the height of the European economic crisis, came to about $35 US each), but it was possible to order a simple breakfast in the room for considerably less. Our only real complaint was the hotel's driver who fleeced us on our trip to the airport, but the hotel has offered to reimburse us for the carfare, and said they were terminating the driver. You can't ask for much more than a hotel that gets most things right and tries to make good if something goes wrong. We liked it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Bruce M
Reviews.Content: Great Position. Excellent room larger than expected. It was a delux room with a king bed expensive by Australian standards but worth the money. We have no hesitation in recommending it to others. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: danholl
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking and we could not have hoped for better. It was the month of August and we received a very interesting deal. We choose a renovated room, under the roof and it was wonderful. The wallpaper behind the bed was a drawing of Parisian roofs in black and white, the floor was parquet, the low shelves along the window were in light wood decorated with only white objects. All very modern, clean and tasteful. The shower room was small but designed cleverly and beautifully. The hotel is located on the Rive Gauche (Left Bank) just across the pastry shop of La Duree. The neighbourhood is wonderful with lots of beautiful boutiques, art shops, restaurants, universities and much more. Certainly a better choice than the over-crowded touristy Rive Droite!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: T0hl
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel in The middle of The 6th err. Saint Germain quarter . Stayed there for 3 nights and received a bill for 1000 € ( special reduced offer for Junior suite ) expensive taken into consideration that it only included breakfast for 1 pers. :-) The Junior Suite was nice and spacious.. GREAT location .. Nice restaurants within 5 min. walk. Close to Louvre and .. Go for the Segway Tour ( big fat tires Paris ) a great way to get around in Paris .. ( 4 hour Tour )

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very cute room, but small”
Reviews.Author: Yon1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and the location can't be beat. The desk was warm and responsive. The room was wonderful and recently renovated, but also very small -- had a problem opening my suitcase, and keep in mind I was traveling alone (although with a full-size suitcase). Anyhow, I would certainly come back and warmly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: candaflo
Reviews.Content: Able to snag 2 nights in a Junior Suite - what a treat. Great location but is noisy if windows left open (Paris) and air conditioner doesn't work that well. Room service was surprisingly cheap given the high cost of rooms. Stayed a 3rd night in a standard room - bed not so comfy but room was just as nice (smaller of course).

Reviews.Title: “Superb location in the heart of the left bank & easy walking to a host of Paris sights. Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SharonR511
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel in 2000 when I travelled solo to Paris on a business trip, so I was a little nervous that it wouldnt be as good as I remembered or live up to all my positive comments at the time. Well having just stayed there for 4 nights, it was absolutely as good as I recalled and my husband was equally impressed. The rooms are spotless, modern, chic and have double glazed windows that you can open for fresh air. We stayed in room 43 which was incredibly spacious and had its own separate sitting area - just fabulous for our longer stay. It is a little noisy with the windows open but this did not disturb us that much and much preferred to sacrifice a little street noise for fresh air. However, I have to confess that it is the location of this hotel that I absolutely love the most. Right in the heart of the Left Bank, easy walking to the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Eiffel Tower and the center of Paris. Great streets to explore and stroll through, soaking up the atmosphere. Great cafes, boulangeries, restaurants, art galleries and shops all around - so you are never short of somewhere to stroll to and have a meal, snack or drink. And if you just want to sit and people watch while sipping a drink at a cafe - even better ! We chose not to eat breakfast at the hotel, but rather had croissants and coffee at nearby cafes - wonderful ! It is only a short stroll to the metro station so you can easily venture further afield to places like Montmarte with ease. We will defininitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - stylish and no frills”
Reviews.Author: SummerhouseKent
Reviews.Content: Ideal location which makes it very easy to explore the area and to access all the sights via inteersting walks and bridges. Plenty of restaurants to choose from. The rooms are moderate in size, but stylishly finished – don’t expect a big bathroom and luxe, but it is super comfortable . Breakfast has improved (we have stayed 3 times) but is never a main event in France!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - the best neighbourhood for chic boutiques”
Reviews.Author: PurdeyHJ
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a long weekend, staying at the La Villa St-Germain. The hotel is so convenient - you can get a direct Metro straight from Paris Nord and then it's just a couple of minutes walk from St Germain station to the hotel. The hotel is simple, but stylish. It's clean, comfortable, and the staff are friendly. The best point is it's fabulous location - it is in the heart of the chic St Germain shopping area and you also have the patisserie of renowned French chef Pierre Herme just a few minutes walk. Lots of good restaurants nearby too. My only regret about the weekend is that we didn't spend more time in the local neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravelhappyNy
Reviews.Content: Our second stay to this 6e arrondissement hotel. We love the location - perfect for galleries and cafes and really living the Paris experience. Though jr. suite is roomy by Paris standards, the hotel service is pretty minimal -- and it's not inexpensive. No evening turndown service, minimal knowledge at the front desk (couldn't figure out how to call London, or how to transfer a call to the room!) We'll stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, service was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: nicko_jess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Villa Saint-Germain for a week to kick start our Honeymoon across Paris, Italy and Hong Kong. The staff were really helpful, we had limited french language skills, the concierge called through to our various bookings/trips for us and organised everything for us. The breakfast was quite nice, not a whole lot of choice, but the scrambelled eggs certainly were done well!! The room we had was very nice, the bathroom was quite large and the bed very comfortable. The location was one of the best parts though, it is walking distance from the Lourve, Notredame, the Eiffel Tower and there are so many cafes and bars around the place. The Metro is very close by, and I was just amazed at how efficient the whole system ran, for such a large city, they do it so well!! If you want to enjoy a reasonably priced, magnificently located hotel in your next holiday to Paris, then I recommend La Villa Saint-Germain!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stylish base in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ginjaninja2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our 10th wedding anniversary. It is quite a small hotel in terms of public space, very quiet & we never saw any other people in the bar area. This could well be due to the fabulous location of this hotel, close to all the cafes and restaurants that St Germain has to offer. It was an easy stroll across the river to the Louvre and other attractions. We enjoyed the food and atmosphere at the nearby bistro on the corner of Rue Jacob and Rue Bonaparte. We also had excellent service there. We found the room very comfortable and furnishings were contemporary as advertised. All in all a very enjoyable stay and good value for a stylish hotel in a popular area of this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RubyFoodie
Reviews.Content: After visiting Paris earlier this year, we decided to stay in the heart of one of our favorite neighborhoods in Paris, the St. Germain. On paper, the hotel La Villa appeared perfect. However, this "cozy" "hip" boutique hotel is anything but a gem. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a courteous staff, but in a bleak charmless lobby. Our room was even worse. We opened the door to dark moldy carpets, dingy curtains, and furnitings that should have been replaced 15 years ago and a lingering odor. I am very surprised at how many high marks this hotel has received. It appears to be that the hotel lives on its reputation of being in the heart of the St. Germain and it appeared to us that the owners take no pride in maintaining this hotel. After one night's stay, we moved to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: LHR_NYC
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel opposite from Laduree and a short walk from Pierre Herme, as well as boutiques, markets and the Seine. The room itself was merely decent, decorated in a contemporary style, but the furnishings and linens were not of a particularly high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris experiance”
Reviews.Author: DaznLiza
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel perfectly placed right in the heart of the St Germain district. It is a mere two minuete stroll from the famous "Deux magots" cafe and is close to the metro ,many restaurants and designer shops. The rooms are beautifully designed and are quite large by Paris standards. The hotel staff could not be more helpful be it book a restaurant or excursion or just offer some local insight. being a reguler visitor to Paris this hotel will betop of our list when we next travel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Professpr
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel in Saint Germain du Pres. This is the third time I have stayed there and they never disappoint. I stayed there for two nights last week,the first night at 150 euros and the second at 265 since it was the higher weekend rate. So while the 2nd night was pricey, on average, the rate was reasonable (for Paris). I stayed in a standard toom which was very well appointed. The furnishings had a contemporary feel which I like. Bathrooms are tiny but well appointed. LCD TVs in the room. The staff are wonderful. It is a small hotel so they get to know you. They will help you with all your requests. Nice lobby that serves drinks in the evenings. Nice, cozy breakfast room downstairs from the lobby. I ate there because I needed to eat before the neighborhood restaurants opened. The location is fabulous. There are numerous art galleries, antique store, furniture stores, boutiques and cafes in the neighborhood, many representing Paris' finest designers and merchants. Pierre Frey (fabrics) has an outlet there, Laduree (tea salon with the best macaroons and a line coming out the door). I love Restaurant Paul for breakfast and Petit Zinc (seafood restaurant) for dinner. Dior is next door as are many other high end stores. It is a short walk to the Seine,across the bridge to the Louvre etc. I recommend this hotel without hesitation. They do have Internet specials on their website so look for those.

Reviews.Title: “Huuuummmmm”
Reviews.Author: p21ccs
Reviews.Content: "Nice" is the operating term. Great location. Incredible location. But we felt the price was a little steep for the room quality. not much included. No free internet. But there is a little bar entering rue Saint Adres des Arts that will give you access per beer or coffee. Breakfast is so so yet expensive. Rooms are larger than expected. Bathrooms are modern and comfortable. The daily cleaning is reliable and thorough. Bottom line, next time we will be seeking to try something else for our money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rockemsockemrobot
Reviews.Content: I liked the boutique hotel, but the best thing about it is its location in the middle of the very exciting area of St. Germain de Pres. I was in Paris on business, so use of the internet was very important to me. Unfortunately, for 2 of my 3 days at the hotel, the internet failed to work. The hotel staff agreed to go to a neighboring hotel to get me access to the other hotel's wireless. The price of the hotel was high and I thought it was worth slightly less than the price. The bathroom was nice, but the sink, which is very modern, was hard to use because the way the water came out, it was difficult to wash my face without getting the whole floor wet. The only English stations on the tv were news stations. I would prefer a full satellite system that allows access to other stations worldwide, but this was a minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice size room. Modern decor.”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea23Nyc
Reviews.Content: Visiting Paris for the first time since 2000 with someone who had never been there. Usually stay in 3 star hotels but thought we would upgrade. It was well worth it. Lovely hotel room in a great location. A fun street close to many things. The room was very quiet and bright. Unlike some other places I've stayed in Paris the room and bathroom were both a nice size and looked like they had recently been remodeled. The decor is modern so some might find it lacks charm. The staff at the desk weren't the most helpful but they were nice enough. Overall, I can recommend a stay without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: brill95
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got one thing going for it - its location. It's smack in the middle of Saint Germain, round the corner from Les Deux Magots and Cafe Flore and a five minute walk away from the Louvre and Notre Dame, so that at least is great. But it's really expensive for what it is. We booked for two nights.The room cost was 385 euros for a deluxe room and 285 for a comfort room. They were both on the top floor of the hotel - the attic. The comfort room was very small, the deluxe room was bigger but they both looked shabby, with dull furniture and two poky attic windows which brought in practically no light. They were definitely not the kind of rooms you would want to spend one extra minute in. The bathroom looked like a throwback from the 90's with stainless steel basins that were constantly wet because the water had nowhere to drip. We came back both nights quite late but the noise of revellers in the street went onto 4/5 in the morning , with the noise of cars starting up soon after that. So if you're a light sleeper forget it! That said, the service was pleasant, The guys at the front desk were helpful and nice to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Chic little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: kbarch
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at La Villa to start and end our month-long trip to France and Germany which began and ended in Paris. We had booked only the first stay intending to find, for variety's sake, a different hotel in Paris for our return trip. But we were so happy with La Villa that we decided we had to return. First all, St. Germain is a great area of Paris for a tourist. You can walk to most cultural attractions like the major museums. The restaurants and cafes in St. Germain and the adjacent Latin Quarter are many, varied and most often wonderful. The ambiance of the little streets is well, very Left Bank. And the hotel is only a block away from the Metro which can get you anywhere in Paris including, with a transfer at Gare Du Nord, to Charles DeGaulle Airport (a stunning $60 cab ride). This is a very hip little hotel, excuse the cliche. The rooms are small but well designed. The staff was extraordinarily helpful with directions and with restaurant booking. I have to say I was not thrilled by the one recommendation of theirs that we took. It was too touristy. But they gladly got us tables at other places that we had researched. Tip: you really need to book at Paris restaurants, even neighbohood bistros. The front desk lent us a Paris guidebook for both our stays. Our stay at the beginning of June was more relaxed that our return stay at the end of June. Fewer tourists, cooler weather, less waiting to get into museums etc. I look forward to spending more time in Paris and La Villa will be my hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “charming quiet hotel in a fabulous part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Peagreen98
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at La Villa Saint-Germain three times now and wilst I have stayed in other places near by - I really do love this place. It's comfy beds, uncomplicated design and fantastic location in St. Germain The interiors are a modern take on the understated but in lovely fabrics - think velvets, cord and leather - all in chocolates, creams and dark reds. I have even copied the curtains and have them in my bedroom at home. The bathrooms are smart but in typical Parisian style so very tiny you have to take turns. The little breakfast room in basement is bright and the bread fresh and good, as is the coffee. The bar on the ground floor good for a late night cap. In the local area there are great cafe's to while away the hours, good restuarants, art galleries and great shopping from Louis Vuitton, Sonia Rykiel to Paul & Joe, Agnes B and lots of independant shops. Metro is less than 2 mins away The front desk staff are polite and make you welcome on check in - they always tell me I need more practice at my french, which I do! Once the receptionist told me she was going to quizz me from the morning's paper - she was joking, I was scared. This is a lovely find - not at the top end of the market but its great nether the less.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Gem”
Reviews.Author: timitart
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for three nights and were upgraded from a Deluxe room to a Suite on the 5th floor. Clean, modern, and an extremely friendly staff all made our stay most pleasant. It was also surprisingly quiet for Paris. Our room had a few skylights which helped brighten up the gray January days. Front desk staff extremely helpful and spoke English. Thumbs up. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a find !!”
Reviews.Author: mixers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from two days celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary in Paris. We took the Eurostar service from the new St. Pancras terminal and found the journey simple, fast and so much better than flying. We had originally booked another hotel in an area close to Les Halles, but having been put off by negative reports on the neighbourhood decided to look for somewhere in St. Germain des Pres. Leaving it to the last minute (just over a day before departure) our options were slightly reduced and after much internet searching we found that La Villa St. Germain could offer us a superior room at a reduced price of € 230 (regularly € 285). We happily booked this and are we glad that we did. I had requested that they give us the best room at the price quoted because it was a special occasion and on arrival the charming receptionist showed us to a junior suite (normal quoted price € 445) which she said that they would like us to have for our wedding anniversary - for the € 230 they had quoted. Our rooms (longe and bedroom) were decorated in creams and browns and situated on the first floor with a double aspect looking out onto the rue Bonaparte and the lovely rue Jacob. Large by Parisian standards with ample storage space, smallish bathroom with tiny bath but extremely strong power shower. There were a good selection of toiletries etc, large fluffy towels and massive bath robes. There was a safe for valuable and the double glazing made the room both quiet and warm - it was very cold in Paris but with clear blue skies and sunshine. The hotel is situated right in the heart of this buzzy area in the fashionable 6th arrondissement and the nearest metro was a 5 minute walk away. 10 minutes walk to the Seine and about 20 minutes to La Musee D'Orsay. Lots of interesting shops and here are two eating tips. The hotel web site recommends the Bistro de Paris in the rue de Lille (about 8 minutes walk away) and we found the food, prices and service excellent in a traditional setting. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as we usually find this over priced, so we found an excellent artisan boulangerie Eric Kayser at the rue de Bac about 10 minutes walk away. Wonderful cakes, bread and pastries and great for a coffee & croissant for € 2.50. In summary,Trip Advisor reports of La Villa St. Germain have been patchy and we can't comment on the 'more ordinary rooms' although we did peek into a couple that were being cleaned and they looked fine. All we can report is a wonderful place to stay for a special occasion, very comfortable, ideally situated and with friendly, helpful staff without exception.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, modern hotel in good location in St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: spinesrgn
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in very good location. Very modern (think small W hotel). Service was fine. Clean, spacious rooms with nice marble bathrooms. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No particular feelings...”
Reviews.Author: nroth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in La Villa Saint Germain 3 nights in June 2007 in the room 32 which is a suite. We were very surprised because we booked a superior room at 285EUR and were awarded this suite which costs 445EUR! This was a real surprise! The suite is very large and has 2 disctincts rooms, the bedroom and the "sofa room", the rooms are separated by a sliding door. Bathroom and toilets are separated. The overall design of the room is very "classical trendy" in brown colours. Nice but not nothing special. The bed was 2x2 (meters) and it was 2 mattress. Overall the room was good, but definetely not at the regular price of 445EUR. Bad point of this room: The streets below are very very noisy!! It crosses rue bonaparte and rue jacob, and bot streets are noisy at night and even on saturday morning, the garbage truck was there at 7am... Breakfast is charged 15EUR and is fair. Usual stuff. Hotel staff is very friendly. Hotel location: the hearth of Saint-Germain. Metro line is 2 minutes walk from the hotel and is line 4. Bottom line: if you are really willing to pay 445EUR, you can surely find better deals somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not bad room”
Reviews.Author: JohnbSWLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews below. The key thing about this hotel is its faultless location - that is worth paying the money for alone - right in the heart of St Germain and a very short walk to the Seine, Louvre etc. The room was just fine/ok, not great - it was quite plain and quite small and I would have expected more for a 4 star hotel. However it was perfectly pleasant and clean. Overall, would recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the area”
Reviews.Author: margaret279
Reviews.Content: Hotel great but room too hot - a/c didn't seem to make a difference. Probably should have told reception. Had to open window - big mistake. Revellers outside on Friday and Saturday kept us awake as they wended their way home (luckily not to our hotel). Hotel room excellent, although a bit small for the price! TV OK - got Sky news and CNN. Bed queen sized and room clean. Bathroom small - as was bath- but had clean towels every day (unnecessary) and fluffy bathrobes, plus toiletries. Was not any better equipped than some cheaper hotels in Holland and Belgium. Breakfast disappointing. We had it as a special "free" deal from Opodo but it was only bread, crossant, OJ, pastry and coffee. We are used to the sumptious Dutch breakfasts or the Campanile ones. I don't think it was value for money but Paris 6e is always expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my short stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jeffdoc
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from a short vacation in Paris. I had wanted to stay near the Saint Germain Metro. This hotel was more expensive than I had hoped but Paris was crowded (Fashion Week, trade shows) and most of my other choices were booked. I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location was excellent: a block and a half from the Metro stop, surrounded by interesting shops and cafes, close to the Seine. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, spoke English comfortably, enjoyed my halting French, made reservations each night for dinner and arranged airport transportation. I found the hotel to be well equipped with relatively large rooms for this area (if it is within your budget, go for the higher end rooms for a little more space) and compact but well equipped bathrooms. I enjoyed the hotel's design--udated French with muted colors. The room was very quiet (double windows) and seemed well-ventilated by the A/C system; I never tried to open the windows. I did not have breakfast at the hotel because the it seemed quite expensive (compared to the local cafes) and the dining room was in the lower level of the lobby--I prefer drinking coffee and people watching at street level. All in all, it was a great stay and I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a small, relatively modern hotel in this part of the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferanne
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, clean and reasonably spacious hotel in a wonderful area of St Germain de Pres. The staff were very attentive and extremely helpful with quite good english, The breakfasts were delicious. Spacious bathroom but most importantly the cleanliness of the room was excellent. Situated in not a very busy street so the noise level wasn;t bad at all early in the morning. Would most definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. Paris was extremely hot during our visit and it was wonderful to return to the very quiet air conditioned room. The hotel staff were very helpfull and went out of their way to assist us. In July the hotel is still wrapped in plastic but that did not hamper our very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good in its way”
Reviews.Author: Jadw59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well situated if you want to be on the left bank. I think the rooms are good and the staff are pretty friendly and helpful. I was, however, pretty disappointed when we arrived to find the hotel wrapped in plastic while something was done to its outside. Fortunately we were a floor above the plastic (4th) and got my daughter moved to the 5th when she arrived. On the website, it said that the work would be finished by the end of April and we stayed in mid-May. It may be all finished by now but don't book without the clearest information on any refurbishment going on.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the hotel "La Villa St Germain" this month. Everything is good : location, hotel decoration, helpfull staff. We were surprise to find sombody speeking russian at the reception. We will come back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique pricing, fair offerings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a couple of weeks ago for a good number of nights. The location was perfect. Yet, the rooms (ours was an "upgraded one with what seemed to be almost a king bed") were tiny. The toilet was about 4 feet away from my wife's head in bed (behind a closet door, [wonderfully romantic]). The outside of the building [they don't tell you this when you book] is currently undergoing a major 'facelift' with scaffolding, blasting and drilling from 8am to 6pm so there is absolutely no way you could take an afternoon nap (which is not good if you are on a red-eye from N.A.) The "restaurant" facilities (if you can call them that) are in the basement where one hessitates to venture -- but, you will probably eat elsewhere if you stay there since there is so much in the neighborhood. The lighting in the hallway is dark and dingy and the hallways to the rooms themselves are cramped. Although the rooms have a boutique 'feel' (like they claim) I would likely look elsewhere knowing what I know now because I'd hope for more bang for my buck.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: lrnyn
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights. Location is great, on a small street off St Germain des Pres. Metro stop is very close. Many restaurants in the area...but wouldn't recommend Le Petit Zinc...quite disappointing. Rooms are large, bathrooms are reasonable (you do have to hold the shower head though...). Internet access is expensive and SLOW 25euro and 5 bps. No fitness center. Found the staff to be very nice and helpful. Overall a reasonable hotel but a bit overpriced for the lack of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The best small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: leemurphy1
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 great nights in Paris at La Villa hotel. The location is fantastic - only a short walk away from loads of exciting restaurants and cafe-bars in the happening Latin Quarter. Try out Le Pres Aux Clercs next door (Hemingway's old haunt apparently, he used to live close by) - the food is fairly expensive but very good. The staff at La Villa are very helpful and the rooms clean and well-decorated. My only complaint is that the baths are very small! This is definitely the best hotel in Paris and I will certainly be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “SO rude at La Villa”
Reviews.Author: CDG_NOW
Reviews.Content: La Villa has a great location but the quality of service it is SO poor. The people here were cold, unwelcoming and we found the hotel to be somewhat souless. Small rooms - and they charge you for EVERYTHING, even internet access which was very slow and did not work. There are so many better hotels in this area for the $$.
